intro: Pimpinella saxifraga f. oblonga, commonly known as the broad-leaved cowparsley, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive fern-like appearance and small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
